page.title: 01CASTLE HEDINGHAM
page.content: { Castle Hedingham}is a very compact village although there are lots of large arable farms growing mainly wheat, barley, beans and sugar beet. The village is really centred around the Norman Keep. At the west side of the village is the main road, the A604. Running parallel to the A604 is a steam railway which had been demolished but is now being rebuilt as a railway museum. The buildings that small businesses use were not always used for that purpose. There are 900 people on the electoral roll and 52 children under 5, 128 children from 5-11 and 72 from 11-18. There are two new estates which were built in 1965 and 1974.
